title: Transmission Electron Microscopy of Formaldehyde Lead Bromide and Iodide Perovskite Quantum Dots
content: Lead halide perovskite nanocrystals (PNCs) showcase exceptional optical properties, making them for diverse optoelectronic applications [1, 2]. In particular, the single-photon emission behavior in PNCs has potential applications in quantum information technologies [3-5]. This work involves studying PNCs of varying sizes infused within a matrix with strong quantum confinement regime to gain insights into their single-photon emission capabilities. In particular, a 3D-FAPbBr3 matrix incorporated with FAPbI3 and FAPb(BrxI1-x)3 were imaged. Synthesizing these materials involves colloidal methods where metal halides react with organic ligands in a solvent to control nanocrystal size, composition, and properties.
